case.summary: The defendant was marginally successful in a personal injury lawsuit and now sought her costs -- She had won a ruling of 90% liability against the main defendant as a cross-claim in a motor vehicle accident where the defendant had settled the action instituted by the plaintiff -- Held: In the circumstances where there was an apportionment of liability in the tort claim, it is appropriate to apportion the award of cost by the same percentage -- Costs in the amount of $1,000 were awarded, plus disbursements, to the plaintiff by cross-claim.
